main event: A large bright white object was observed hovering very low over a highway in Dayton, Ohio, moving slowly and estimated to be the speed of a balloon.
interesting points: The sighting was recorded on multiple occasions in October 1961., One observer described the object appearing brighter than nearby stars., The object was tracked on ground radar but disappeared from sight., The observer stated it seemed to fade as it moved away., Comments on the potential identification of the object suggest it could be a weather balloon or an astronomical object.
witness description: The witness described the object as bright and white, resembling a balloon, and stated it could not be visually confirmed but was tracked on radar.
